intro: Eriogonum heracleoides var. heracleoides, commonly known as desert parsley, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a perennial herb with a taproot and hairy, basal leaves that are often divided into lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in a dense, spike-like inflorescence. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sagebrush steppe and rocky soils. The plant is adapted to withstand drought and has a long blooming period, typically from spring to early summer.
